alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 10 at 4:18PM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM MST /8 PM CST/ THURSDAY TO 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 to 20 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 25 to 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 7 PM MST /8 PM CST/ Thursday to 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the expected cold wind chill readings for the Watch period will occur at night, but will linger into the daytime hours each day. Overall, below zero readings are expected.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
